Can the Canadian 3rd Division find sufficient air, naval, and artillery support to clear Juno Beach and advance inland through the bocage country to the south and link up with the British beaches to the east? Or will the German defenders of the 716th Division react in time, bringing up their anti-tank assets to stop the Canadians on the beaches as they did at Dieppe two years earlier? The German commander, Erwin Rommel, planned to stop the invasion on the beaches… and it nearly happened!

Game Components:

One 4-page, color Standard Rules booklet
40 color, 2-sided die-cut 1/2” mounted pieces
28 round 5/8” counters
One 11” x 17” color game map with tables
1 BATTLESSON (TM) sheet
Illustrated Examples of Play, Exclusive and Optional Game Rules
Part of a 5 game series!




Ages: 12 and up
Complexity: 4 on a 9 scale
Solitaire Suitability: 8 on a 9 scale
Game Scale: Each unit is 1 company to regiment, each hex is 1 kilometer, and each turn is about 4.5 hours.
37724.name: Paul Koenig's D-Day: The Canadian Beach

37725.name: Zit-Zingo
37725.description:
"Zit-Zingo: The Travel Game

Directions: Game is played like Bingo. Players watch for objects along the road and cross them off on cards. First player to mark five objects in a row is winner.

When younger children play, change rules so that first object seen by all players goes to first player; second object to second; etc.

Players may try for Double-Zingo (two lines of five in a row, Triple-Zingo, or even Grand-Zingo - entire card filled

A variation of the game for two players is for each player to be assigned one side of the road - players place a check mark on their card as objects are seen. Time or mileage limit is set and player having most check marks on his card is the winner."

37726.name: Tyrants of Rome
37726.description:
From the publisher: "Lost Battalion Game's latest release offers 2-6 players the chance to struggle for supreme authority atop the declining Roman Empire, employing attacks by Legions, barbarians, bribes, assassins, and even the whims of the gods to weaken their opponents or strengthen themselves.

Tyrants of Rome™ contains a total of 128 cards, in two decks. Build your faction of wily or powerful leaders from five regional nationalities of the empire, as depicted in the Leader deck. A large Action Card deck allows for conflicts and excitement with every new play, with options and hard choices at every turn."

37727.name: Suburban Wars
37727.description: Suburban Wars is a stand-alone card game of Nutty Neighborhood Nonsense in which the objective is to the score the most Bliss points, which you do by playing Object cards from your hand to your Lot or Action cards from your hand on your opponents' Lots. In addition to the Object and Action cards from the Neighbor deck there's an Event deck with People and Occasion cards that keep the game spiced up. People wander the neighborhood causing trouble for you and your neighbors and everyone has to stop for the next holiday and partake in the festivities, usually in the form of some tweak to your hands or the rules. There are 120 cards and the game can be played by 2-6 players of ages 8+ in about 30 minutes.

37728.description:
Players in Rock the Beat do just that, creating a steady beat by slapping their thighs and clapping their hands to the rhythm of the Queen song "We Will Rock You".

At the start of the game, each player receives a card showing a symbol that the player can create with her hands: deer antlers, thumb's up, thumbing your nose, etc. Once the beat is established, the start player replaces the clap with her own symbol, then the symbol of another player, e.g., slap, slap, <<thumb's up>>, slap, slap, <<antlers>>. The player who holds the antlers card must repeat his own symbol on the next clap, then "throw" someone else's signal. When a player messes up the rhythm or fails to respond to his signal, he receives a new symbol card, while his old one goes to the player who threw him the symbol. This latter player now has two symbols in front of him, making gameplay trickier for him. Who will keep rocking the beat and collecting cards?
37728.name: Rock the Beat

37729.name: Star Trash
37729.description:
In year 2112 a party of heroes start to go where no green little man is never gone. This heroes are the crew of the Star Trash, the worst element of the planet. During the travel they will fight aliens, diseases and damages but they will also meet friendly aliens that will help to repair the ship and to mutate.

Star Trash is a semi-collaborative game and a semi-competitive game (that means that one player will win or all the players will loose) and it is a parody of many different science-fiction novels.

Official Website
http://www.rappospiel.eu/

37730.name: Im Fadenkreuz: Europa
37730.description:
The game is about locating different places on a silent (i.e. no landmarks, towns, rivers, only borders)map of Europe. The questions on picture-cards range from: "Where is this Bridge?" to "Where is the Airport Leifur Eiriksson"?

The Players have to place cardboard rings of different diameter (which are worth the more points the smaller the ring is) on the map.

The solution is shown using the "GPS"-coordinates, not Global Positioning System but "Grüner Positionierungs-Schnürsenkel". Two shoe laces are spanned across the board. If your ring encircles the intersection point, you get the according points.

37731.name: Manille
37731.description:
A French/Belgian popular trick-taking card game mostly similar to Belote, although a little bit more straightforward. More popular than Belote in some regions (e.g. north of France or in Belgium).

Usually played 2v2, but there exist variants for 2 or 3 players.

37732.description:
All players are gorillas, but rather small and not that tough. They live together on an island at the zoo. By playing (single) bananas or whole bunches (cards) they try to obtain benefits from the biggest and most powerful gorilla on the isle, Boss Kito. With these benefits they score points and the player with the highest score at the end of the game is the winner.

The game will be published in Essen in an international edition with English, German, French and Dutch rules.
37732.name: Boss Kito

boardgamehonor.18866: 2009 JoTa Best Heavy Board Game Nominee

37734.description:
In the mountain there are veins of precious stones. The players build tunnels in the mountain, establish stations in the mountain and in the city, discover veins of precious stones, acquire precious stones, and sell them. The players get points for stations in the city and for selling precious stones. The winner is the player with the most points.



Game Summary
The board is a hex grid, with city spaces along most of the edges. The center hex is a vein of yellow gems: place all 9 in a stack there. The rest of the gems go in their individual market areas (priced 1-9 based on supply).Each round (3 in game), add 5 contracts (showing gem combinations; score big VP if completing them; lose some VP if cannot) to the display. Then auction (using VP) turn order chips 1-4. Players then each get the same set of tiles (hexes with various numbers of track exits, prospecting tiles, veins, option tiles, etc.) plus a dynamite hex based on their turn order chip. Take turns taking contracts until everyone passes.

Then, on your turn, play 1-4 of your 12 actions. These allow you to place tracks (expanding previous tunnels; you can also cover track tiles with tiles having more exits), stations, or veins (which you supply with gems of your choice). Gems (6 types, 9 tokens each) each have their own market where they are stored and which set their max sell price. The last action is prospecting, where you create a path from one of your stations to another, passing through as many veins as possible: take one gem from each vein.

After everyone's 12 actions are used, any exposed dynamite tracks explode and take the adjacent tracks as well (all these are placed in the Buy Pool, which can be accessed by turning in Option tiles)! You score for stations in cities based on the number of empty hexes. Then, for each gem type, players bid (Dutch auction style, bidding for the lowest price they'll accept) and may sell their gems for VP at their bid price.

At game end (after 3 rounds), players sell off all their remaining gems (with lowest VP selling next gem), there's another city scoring, and players lose VP for incomplete orders. Most VP wins!
37734.name: Cavum

37735.name: Passport to Australia
37735.description: A game that sees you race around Australia, to see who can collect all the items needed and then be the first back.

37736.name: Transport Tycoon
37736.description:
Created to celebrate 100 years of Ewals Cargo Care logistics.

Collect cargo from one part of Europe and deliver it to another. Increase the size of your truck, then your cargo, and build your logistics empire.

A surprisingly sophisticated game for a corporate giveaway.

37737.name: Bismark
37737.description:
Bismark [sic] is a low priced 2 player strategy board game covering the epic naval confrontation between the German battleship (actually known as the Bismarck, with a 'c') and the British Royal Navy.

In may of 1941, the German navy has sent is greatest battleship out to begin hunting British commerce, trying to disrupt the British naval supply lines and otherwise distract the British while the bulk of Germany's armed forces were heading eastward. In this game the German player must take the Battleship Bismark and the heavy cruiser Prinz Eugen out to sea and north of the British isles past the Denmark Straits and out into the Atlantic where it can prey upon and sink vital British convoys.

The British must sink the Bismark at all costs. Failure to do so will mean a menace upon their shipping they can ill afford. The might of the Royal Navy is surely capable of the task, but the real challenge will be, how long will it take and what will be the costs. Victory in Bismark will depend on how much shipping the Germans are able to sink before the Brits are able to sink the Bismark.

Game Components:
1 22x17 inch Full Color Map in 2 pieces
1 D10
Rules
Over 90 full color cut out units on adhesive paper
Cardboard to stick counters on

37738.description:
In Master Builder, the players are builders in a small town (represented by 3D cardboard buildings). They try to acquire building contracts, which they then attempt to complete.

The contracts are gained by bidding on them. After that, the buildings must be constructed using workers. Each worker has his own specialty, and you'll need several different workers to complete a building.
Initially, players hire these workers to complete the buildings. Later, these workers can leave them, sometimes because they have been lured away by other players.

Master Builder is #4 in the Valley Games Modern Line.
37738.name: Master Builder

37739.description:
In Sutter's Mill the players experience the sudden rise and decline of the Californian town of Coloma during the gold rush.

They first build up the town, bring new citizens into it, and, last but not least, dig gold. However, when it is time and the gold vein is almost spent, they better take their belongings and get the hell out of Coloma!

In the game, this is represented by a division in two phases: build up followed by tear down. At the beginning of the game, all players start in the build up phase. It is up to the players themselves to decide when there's no more profit to be had and to enter the tear down phase. Each player makes this choice for himself, so while some players are already tearing down the place, others will still be building up.
37739.name: Sutter's Mill

37740.name: Co-Op Community Challenge
37740.description:
Community Challenge is a unique game created by the Co-Op as a promotional game.

Each player has four pawns which are moved around the board as instructed by the PLAY cards. There are 10 homes positioned around the board - Hospital, Countryside etc.. Access to one of these "homes" can only be gained by possession of the correct card. You can also send opponents back to their START space by various actions. The winner is the first player t get all four pawns into homes

66749.name: Secrets of the Third Reich: Doomsday

37741.description:
The year is 1949, and the world is still ravaged by the horrors of World War II.

London and Berlin have both been obliterated by Atom Bombs, and Northwest Europe and Eastern Russian are ravaged by the the aftermath of V-Gas - a deadly nerve agent which kills the victim and then re-animates the corpse.

And yet the war still rages. Small battle groups of British, American, German and Russian troops still engage in combat, aided by new technology and darker magics.

It's a world where Bullet Proof Vests, Powered Armour, Assault Rifles and Panzer Mecha sit alongside Werewolves, Vampires, Drug enhanced Super-Soldiers, Psychics and Zombies.

This the world of Secrets of the Third Reich (SOTR).

SOTR is a set of Miniature Wargames rules, which enable opponents to fight battles in a Weird War II setting.

It is supported by a range of 28mm figures, produced by West Wind Productions.
37741.name: Secrets of the Third Reich

37742.name: Uncle Scrooge's Gold Race
37742.description: Playing as Huey, Dewey, Louie or Uncle Scrooge, be the first player to deposit your gold bars in Uncle Scrooge's bank and return to Scrooge's house. Ages 7 - 12.

37743.name: Consensus
37743.description:
Ten Noun cards are place on a board (numbers 1 through 10 appear below each card's slot on the board). One Adjective card is placed up on the board as well.

Each player has a pawn and a voting deck of the same color. The voting decks are simply sets of 10 numbered cards. Simultaneously, everyone places one of their voting cards face down, the Noun card number they feel best matches the Adjective.

Majority rules and the Noun with the most votes is the "proper answer." Anyone who voted for that card moves forward one on the (short) scoring track. Once someone reaches the other end of the track, the game is over.

Each round, any noun cards voted for are removed and replaced with new nouns and a new adjective replaces the previous one.

Comes with 100 adjectives and 300 nouns.

Web site is www.consensusgame.com

37744.name: Sommalov med Mazetti
37744.description:
With the theme of a summer vacation, the goal is to be the first to reach the goal. Movement is done by a dice. On the way things can happen that delay you or let you move forward.

The game is made for the Swedish company Mazetti.

37745.name: Kalle Anka i Högertrafiken
37745.description:
The game was made in Sweden at the time when driving was changed from the left to right side of the roads.

The theme is Donald Duck and his friends driving and passing traffic signs.

The goal is to be the first to reach the end. Movement is done by drawing coloured pieces from a bag, and moving to the next place with that colour. On the way things can happen that slow you down or let you move forward.

37746.name: TID för alla-spelet
37746.description:
In the game on the front side, the goal is to be the first to reach the star in the middle, with help of a dice.

On the other side a separate game is available. The goal there is to be the first to reach as many of the hours on the clock as possible. Movement is done around the clock by a dice.

The game was made for the Swedish clock selling company Stjärnurmakarna.

37747.description:
It's a wargame. The fight is between war balloons (represented by cardboard stand ups).
The setting is Steampunk.
It plays on a squared / checked map.
The game uses dice and cards.
The rules are subdivided in three blocks of increasing difficulty.
The game was sold at newsstands. The first release contained the box and the main components.
Following issues (sorry I don't remember how many there were) contained additional war balloons and rules (i.e. clouds).
37747.name: Steampunk: War Baloon

37748.name: Check and Double Check
37748.description:
From the manufacturer:

"A Game of Action and Thrill, developing unexpected situations and startling climaxes so rapidly that you are constantly 'on edge' with suspense."

The game consists of a deck of cards, all of one 'suit,' and a pair of six-sided dice with the six on each replaced by a check mark. Nine cards are dealt to each player, with the four remaining cards forming the discard pile. The dice are thrown by each player in turn, and on each throw all players may discard one card corresponding to the total number thrown.

When a check turns up, the player throwing must take the top card from the discard pile rather than discarding, though other players may discard a card which equals the number thrown on the other die. When two checks are thrown, the throwing player must take two cards. When one player runs out of cards, each other player pays him one cardboard chip for each card remaining in their hand. Players play to "100, 200 or any agreed number of points."

37749.name: Zolfaqar's Blow
37749.description:
Ever since the mock Iranian attack with four Fast Attack Craft upon USN ships sailing though the Straits of Hormuz in January 2008, the USN had been on alert. While American intelligence, in theory, could predict the technological level of the Iranian weaponry, and their own wargames showed USN vulnerabilities, there was always the chance element. The USN had always been on a heightened alert when traversing the Straits, especially when they knew the Iranians had at least 70 anti-ship missiles within range. Not to mention their capability of launching ASMs from aircraft platforms. Not to mention, their Chinese FACs with ASMs. The threat had always been real. The USN continued to have confidence, perhaps wrongly, that their superiority in higher technology could and would keep their ships out of harm’s way.Iran had decided to attack using “swarm” tactics. The USN had itself used such tactics in their own wargames with devastating results. It was found out that using swarm tactics greatly increased the likelihood of Iranian success, even when only Fast Attack Craft were used. That was then. Now, apply the same tactics with ASMs and the scenario was even more horrific. The USN would not make a preemptive strike, that would be political suicide on the world stage. Iraq was still combative as ever. All the USN could do was remain vigilant at all times while moving through the Straits and into the Persian Gulf. If Iran attacked, they would have to make it count as America’s response would literally demolish the Iranian forces in and around the Straits.

Contains:
- 2 11" x 17" maps sheet depicting the battle area.
- One set of 280 die cut ½" playing pieces representing ground combat units.
- One rulebook
- 4 sheets of Charts and tables

37750.name: Opulent Chess
37750.description:
Opulent Chess is a chess variant similar to Christian Freeling's Grand Chess, but with an improved Knight, and two new jumping pieces (the Lion, and the Wizard.) The game is played on a 10×10 board

The Knight moves like a standard Chess Knight, with the added ability to step a single space horizontally or vertically. The Knight is still forced to move to a square of the opposite color with each move.

The Wizard piece is a color-bound leaper invented for Omega Chess. It can make a (1, 3) leap, or move a single space diagonally. Like a Bishop, the Wizard remains on squares of the same color throughout the game.

The Lion is a piece invented by Ralph Betza, which he called a Half-Duck. It has been used recently with the name 'Lion' in games by David Paulowich. This piece may leap either 2 or 3 squares horizontally or vertically, or may step a single space diagonally. This piece stays on squares of the same color except when it makes the somewhat awkward (0, 3) leap.

The Chancellor is a compound piece combining the moves of the Rook and the Orthodox Chess Knight. The Archbishop is a compound piece combining the moves of the Bishop and the Orthodox Chess Knight .

This material was gleaned from www.chessvariants.com

37751.description:
Three player chess on a hexagonal board with two colors of hexagonal spaces (black and white).

There are six bishops (one per color for each player). The pieces have normal starting positions. The standard plastic chess pieces are ivory white, black and gold. There are eight pawns each.

Movement is somewhat complicated:

The king and rook can move in 6 directions - onto adjacent hexes that share a side.
The "diagonal" moves of the queen and bishop involve skipping over the two adjacent hexes of the other colours onto the hex beyond of the same colour. The bishop can thus move in 6 directions, the queen in 12.
The knight can also moves onto 12 possible hexes - it moves two hexes forward and one to the side, always onto adjacent hexes that share a side.
The pawn moves one diagonal hex forward and captures moving two adjacent hexes forward (these are the two hexes on either side of the one it could move to).




There are a few other special rules to deal with castling, pawn promotion and whether a diagonal move can pass between two occupied hexes.
37751.name: Tri-Chess

37752.name: Tiger Chess
37752.description:
Tiger Chess is a game developed in ancient China, In this game; One side controls a "tiger"(a black marker) and the other side controls 12 "humans" (white makers).

On a game board of 8x8 square plus a 2x2 square (tiger cave), "humans" aim to capture the "tiger", by surrounding the "tiger" with four "humans". The "tiger" on the other hand tries to 'eat' the "humans", by simply jumping over the "human" markers, if less than four "humans" survive, the "tiger" wins the game.

Games in the Tiger Chess Family Include:

Two Tigers Chess
Three Tigers Chess

37753.name: Egg Chess
37753.description:
A game like Tic-Tac-Toe, but instead of using circles and crosses uses eggs in different forms. On a 3×3 board, players take turns either adding an egg to an empty square, or changing an egg. The egg can be a whole egg, broken egg, or empty egg.

A whole egg can turn into a broken egg or an empty egg,
A broken egg can turn into an empty egg,
And an empty egg cannot be reformed.




The player who gets three of the same form of eggs in a line on the 3×3 grid wins.

37754.name: Love Game
37754.description:
Taken from the game box:

A passionate game for two players.

The love journey you have long been wishing for. A very humorous and educational game that everyone will enjoy completely!

A great game for two people who are newly in love:
If you still have butterflies in your bellies this is a real love exploration where you get to know everything about each other. You will enter a surprising and wonderful spiral of love.
Play the game and enjoy each other!

A surprising game for experienced couples:
Even though you already have long history of love behind you this game is still a true love discovery.
Enjoy it because no matter if you have known each other for 2, 10 or maybe 40 years you must not miss this creative impulse of love.

The funniest love game for singles:
Don't forget the singles among you, for you too this is a fantastic start on a new romance. Many new relationships start with fun and testing of each other. This game will make sure you will get rid of all the expensive trips to the city to eat and go to the disco, hour long conversations on the phone etc.
Play this game and your wildest dreams will be fulfilled in just one night.

37755.name: Scallywags
37755.description:
Avast! Belay your bickering and gives us our treasure!

Scallywags, originally available as a print-and-play game titled Doubloons!, is a light-hearted game in which players are swashbuckling pirates divvying up their booty.

To start the game, a selection of coins are dumped in the center of the table to form the loot pile. These coins are marked on only one side and are left face-up or face-down as they fall. On a player's turn, he can either take a face-down coin from the pile and add it to his stash or play one card (from three in his hand) to take face-up coins, steal from others, give coins to opponents, and more.

Why would you want to give coins to others? Because once a player has ten coins, he can't receive any more – which means you want to stuff them with all the pennies while making a play for the gold yourself. Once all players have collected ten coins, the game ends and the player with the most valuable stash wins!

37756.description:
Divide and Conquer is an abstract strategy board game for 2-4 players. As the Commander of a battalion of troops, you plan out and execute troop movements to secure objective regions around the game board. Your opponent’s competing troops will cause you to tangle and engage in conflict taking on causalities and slowing your pace to victory. You must anticipate the other players’ strategies by moving with precision and seizing the initiative. Sometimes your position is defensive to block an opponent from an objective and other times you are invading occupied regions to weaken the offensive of another player.

The game mechanics are based in mathematics and game theory, which provides an additional opponent. If you plan optimally, you will not only defeat the other players, but you will also solve the game with a minimal number of movements.

Divide and Conquer is played with 2-4 players of all ages with play lasting 30-45 minutes.

Home Page: http://www.divideandconquergame.com
37756.name: Divide and Conquer

37757.name: The "Roll" of the Missionary
37757.description:
The "Roll" of the Missionary is a short Roll and Move game designed to help the player prepare for an LDS Mission. The players first get baptized as a member of the LDS Church through a series of die rolls. Once that is achieved, the players become missionaries and race to convert as many other people as possible along the track. The game ends with a shake-off to roll each unique symbol at the chapel.

The six dice sides are:
Seek for Truth
Pray
Study the Scriptures
Repent
Warn Your Neighbor
Being Baptized

37758.name: Monopoly: Washington, D.C.
37758.description:
This is the officially licensed Washington, D.C., edition of Monopoly. Here you have Monopoly with a twist.

The game includes tokens made to look like a pretzel, heart, Abraham Lincoln, DC Capitol Building, George Washington, and a money bag.

Board Spaces include C&O Canal, Bureau of Engraving, National Zoo, White House, Pentagon, Tidal basin, Dupont Circle, and other local attractions.

Cards include the 4th of July Celebration! All tokens advance to Washington Monument.

boardgamehonor.18999: 2011 Japan Boardgame Prize U-more Award Nominee

37759.description:
Incan Gold is a quick, fun and tense game in which you and other adventurers explore an old Incan temple in search of gold and treasure. In each of the five rounds, you secretly choose if you want to continue exploring the temple in search of more treasure or retreat to the safety of your camp with your share of the treasure that has been discovered so far.

Each time that an explorer braves new territory, more treasure or a danger appears. When a second card of the same type of danger is turned over, all exposed treasure is buried, leaving the remaining adventurers with nothing. Do you flee the dangerous temple with your portion of the treasure that has been uncovered so far or do you venture into the exciting temple in search of more hidden valuables?

After five rounds of exploration, whoever has the most treasure is the ultimate explorer and winner!

From the publisher: "You and your fellow adventurers travel to Peru to find a ruined Incan temple and its treasures: turquoise, obsidian, and gold. There are also rumors of valuable Incan artifacts. Will you chance dangers like giant spiders, mummies, and fire during your search, or will you escape back to camp and safety, carrying out your loot?"

Re-implemented by:

Risco Total (Released as an unauthorized game. An agreement has since been made between the authors and the publisher.)
37759.name: Incan Gold

37760.name: Hyborian Gates Empires
37760.description:
"Board Game of Dimensional Conquest for 2-6 players. Based on the card game Hyborian Gates."

"There are 6 Dimensions: Atlantis, Hyboria, Asgard, Chaos, Gaea, Osiris. The Dimensions are not directly connected. The only way to get from one dimension to another is by the use of Gates."

"Each dimension is represented by a separate 7 x 7 Grid Board. In the center square of each dimension is a Pyramid."

The first player to control three Pyramids wins the game (except in a two player game, in which four Pyramids must be controlled to win the game.)

37761.name: Ga voor Goud
37761.description:
Trivia game based on the 2008 Beijing Olympics sponsored by Dutch supermarket Plus. It includes a DVD and 15 trivia cards. The other 135 can be collected by shopping at Plus.

Roll the dice, walk the track answer your questions right and steal some medals along the way. Whoever lits the Olympic Flame first ends the game. Winner is the player with the most medal points.

37762.name: Hellboy Hands
37762.description:
"Card game for 2+ players. Theme: Hellboy. Each player is trying to help Hellboy complete Quests on their own turn and preventing their opponents from completing quests on their turns."

The object of the game is to acquire Quest Tokens. A player is awarded a Quest Token each time the player completes a meld. The first player to acquire six Quest Tokens wins the game.

37763.name: Duck Fever
37763.description:
• Roll the dice to determine where you will start your hunt.
• After reaching your hunting destination, begin your hunt by drawing a card.
• Each card will tell you what you have to roll to hit your duck.
• Ducks move around the board as "shots" are made, so hunt where the ducks are!
• Win the game by reaching the limit of 10 ducks!

2-6 players, Ages 8 and up! Hunting for the Entire Family!


http://www.huntingfevergames.com/listcategories.php?cid=243

37764.name: Buck Fever
37764.description:
• Roll the dice to determine where you will start your hunt.
• After reaching your hunting destination, begin your hunt by drawing a card.
• Each card will tell you what you have to roll to hit your deer.
• Just like a real hunt, the difficulty in getting the deer is determined by distance and type of weapon.
• The larger bucks are harder to get, but earn you more points!

37765.name: Pheasant Fever
37765.description:
• Roll the dice to determine where you will start your hunt.
• After reaching your hunting destination, begin your hunt by drawing a card.
• Each card will tell you what you have to roll to hit your pheasant.
• Just like a real hunt, there are many reasons why the pheasant could get away!
• Use the trusty "bird dog" card to guarantee finding a wounded pheasant.
• Win the game by reaching the limit of 10 roosters!

2-6 players, Ages 8 and up! Hunting for the Entire Family!


http://www.huntingfevergames.com/listcategories.php?cid=248

37766.name: Three Tigers Chess
37766.description:
A 2-2 players game based on the Old Chinese Game "Tiger Chess".
A more complex game, with 3 "tigers", and 12 "human".
"human" aim at to capture the tigers, by surrounding the tigers.
"tigers" aim at to eat "human", so that the human cannot capture the tigers.

boardgamehonor.21178: 2010 Charles S. Roberts Best Expansion or Supplement for an Existing Game Nominee

37767.description:
World at War: Operation Garbo takes the popular World at War game system into the hills and valleys of Sweden as their long-kept neutrality is violated by the Soviet Army. Swedish forces include its upgraded Mark 4 variant of the British Centurion tank, the famous Swedish S-tank—which has no turret!—and the PBV 302, a combat-proven APC. Other units include AT helicopters, tracked TOW and SAM launchers, and the hard-hitting, but fragile, IKV 91 tank destroyer. Home Guard units made up of old men with old rifles and fast, jeep-driving recon units support the heavier tank units.

World at War: Operation Garbo is the latest expansion (You'll need to own either World at War: Eisenbach Gap or World at War: Blood and Bridges to play Operation Garbo.) in the World at War series. It features 176 counters, two mounted 11” x 17” maps, and 6 scenarios.
37767.name: World at War: Operation Garbo

37768.name: Dial-Gay for Murder
37768.description: Someone did not like Paul Pernicious, head operator at DIAL-GAY Answering Service. In fact, someone strangled him with the cord from his own headset, even as he worked at the switchboard. It's up to you and your guests to discover who murdered Paul Pernicious-- and why. This is a gay-themed "How to Host a Murder"-style game.

37769.name: Mad Labs
37769.description:
Mad Labs: The Maniacal Mix-N-Match Game of Monstrous Mayhem

As rival mad scientists, you compete to create the most powerful horde of monstrosities to rule the countryside. No! The entire province! No! The world! Bwa-ha-ha-ha!

Through out the game you will play monster Body Parts from your hand to the table. Each part has a unique ability or power. Once a monster is complete (has one of each Body Part) it can start using these powers for you to help you achieve your goals. Each monster is worth a certain amount of points. Incomplete monsters (monsters under construction or MUCs) are worth negative points. If a player starts his or her turn with a set amount of points in their army of monsters he or she wins the game.

37770.description:
Description by Andrea “Liga” Ligabue & W. Eric Martin

The Palio di Siena (known in Italy as Il Palio) is a crazy horse race that takes place twice a year in Siena on July 2 and August 16.

Ten of the 17 Contrade (or city wards) are represented in the race: the seven that were left out of the previous race and a randomly chosen three from the remaining ten Contrade. Each Contrade has particular colors and coats of arms, and the horse and rider are dressed to embody their Contrade. Riders can use their whips on other horses and riders as well as on their own mount, and the winner is the first horse to cross the finish line with its head ornaments in place – whether or not the rider is still on the horse.

New Italian game designer Massimo Pesce, together with the help of Scribabs’ Paolo Vallerga as art director, has produced a nice and simple game about this race. The players control the seventeen Contrade involved in the two races, with ten Contrade taking part in the first race (Palio di Provenzano) and a different set of ten in the second one (Palio dell’Assunta). This set-up means that one or more players might hold Contrade involved with only one race.

Each Contrade is assigned a horse ("la tratta") that can be either a good one ("bono," with a movement die of 3, 4, 4, 5, 5, 6) or a not-so-good one ("brenna," with movement of 3, 3, 4, 4, 5, 6). Since the race lasts for three laps, that small difference can add up over time. In addition to the decorative jockey, players receive nine cards that can be used during the race to create small advantages or slow down opponents.

As for the race itself, like the real Palio, the beginning is somewhat chaotic as horses and riders jockey for position. During the movement phase, if a horse can’t move its entire distance, it risks falling or perhaps just throwing the rider, which doesn’t prevent a horse from winning. The game is all about playing the right cards at the right moment and getting the right rolls.

Palio is simple and quick, the materials are good, and the graphics is great !
37770.name: Palio

37773.name: Das Spiel des Lebens Kartenspiel
37773.description:
The highs and lows of an entire life in just 20 minutes: great advancement or even the total bankruptcy. An exciting life begins with each new shuffle...

The life cards are divided into 4 colors (green/love, blue/education, orange/life, pink/luxury). Each color includes 10 numbered cards and a joker. The joker can be used for any other number. At the end of the game you gain life points for the sets of cards you have made during the game.

There are 2 possibilities to form a set – cards of the same color in number order (4,5,6,7) or a group of the same number (3,3,3). In addition, each life card shows a picture. If these images match your lifestyle cards, you get extra points when playing.

Goal of the Game: to win the most life points by playing life-card sets and achieving your own lifestyle.

37774.description:
This mini-expansion with 10 cards for the Catan Card Game called Turnierkarten T2002 was created by Kosmos in 2001, for use in the card game tournament 2002 only. It was given to all participants of the tournament.
The phyiscal cards were also included in the online version Catan: Das Kartenspiel.
At the 2002 gamefair in the Netherlands, they were distributed as Goud & Piraten (Gold & Pirates).

Most of the cards were added in slightly modified form in the Barbarians & Traders expansion. Since the release of that set, these cards are no longer allowed in tournaments.

Focus in this expansion is on piracy and more options for gold.

Belongs to the Catan Series.

Expands

Catan Card Game
37774.name: De Kolonisten van Catan: Het Kaartspel – Goud & Piraten

37775.name: Fix the Fence
37775.description:
In this fun, challenging memory game, players flip cards to reveal hidden fencing supplies. Locate matching fence posts or wire cards to mend a section of downed fence. Find a match and place it on your mat. But, watch out for broken fence cards! Be the first to fill your mat and Fix the Fence!

Contents:
24 Cards
2 Playing Mats
1 Rulebook

http://www.farmgame.com/fixFence.asp

37776.description: In this children's game the players collect treasure cards of different values by rolling dice.
37776.name: Dobbelschat

37777.description:
In this card game fun is guaranteed! Each player tries to get rid of his cards as quickly as possible so that other players receive lots of negative points. The twist is that high cards are much easier to get rid of one, but bring more negative points! And then there are also ox and donkeys, which can really mess up your plans when you unwittingly have to take them. One thing is clear: at the end, someone is always the donkey!

Re-implements:

Das Grosse und das Kleine A (1996)
Who's the Ass? (2004)
37777.name: Ochs & Esel

37778.name: Super Marchew
37778.description:
Super Marchew is a simple game for children. Game can be played by 2-4 players. The goal is to catch the carrot, which is inside the board.
All materials (rules, board, and tokens) are on this website:
http://adam.wcsw.net/folko/index.php?option=com_content&;view=article&id=55:supermarchew&catid=35:grygotowe&Itemid=63

37779.description:
Chir 1942 is a simple introductory wargames published in Vae Victis "Hors Serie" nr 10 in August 2008. 33 DTP counters and a 11" x 17 " map at battalion level with some companies.

It simulates the battle of December 1942 along the Chir river (so just after the Stalingrad encirclement) where the 11th Panzerdivision of the 48th Panzerkorps managed to destroy the 1st Soviet Tank Corps during the battles near Sovkhoze 79. The book of von Mellenthin "Panzer Battles" describes the story very well. The 11th Panzerdivision destroyed 800 Soviet tanks and mauled several other tank and mechanized corps during all these battles despite a tank strength of only 56 tanks.
37779.name: Chir 1942

37780.name: Silver Surfer
37780.description: A card game based on the comic book character Silver Surfer. The players must play melds of cards describing an encounter with a foe or villain. Each meld scores Plot Points equal to the point total of the cards played in the meld. The player with the most Plot Points when the deck runs out wins the game.

37781.name: Sherwood
37781.description:
"One player is Robin Hood, stealing from the rich to give to the poor. The other player is the most evil Sheriff of Nottingham."

The game uses three custom decks: the Robin Hood Deck, the Sherwood Sheriff Deck, and the Prize Deck. "Object: Accumulate the most victory points by acquiring cards from the Prize Deck."

37782.name: San Juan Hill
37782.description:
"Spanish American War 1898. Card Game for 2 players. One player gets the American deck. The other player gets the Spanish deck."

Each player uses a unique deck of 32 cards. There are seven types of cards in each deck: Infantry Units, Artillery, Leaders, Morale, Equipment, Terrain, and Special. Each card is rated with a force value from 0 to 5. The cards represent elements of the historical campaign.

The game lasts for eight hands. Each hand the players are trying to play cards having a higher total force value. The object is to be the player who wins the most hands. "If both win 4 hands, the game is a draw, and history unfolds as in the books. If The Americans win 5+ hands, then they take the hill with fewer casualties. If the Spanish win 5+ hands, the Americans suffer a military disaster & retreat."

37783.name: Ground Assault Gamma Force
37783.description:
Ground Combat in the Gamma Force Universe
An Anime Toymaster Game for use with the Anime Games System.

Published in 1990, Ground Assault Gamma Force is a stand-alone miniatures game using the Gundam anime series as its core with only a few alterations of names. Predominantly a game of giant robotic tanks (mecha) battling across the solar system - there are rules though that also cover more conventional vehicles and infantry.
Players form teams and then select mecha and other units based either on an agreed upon point system or on what miniatures are available. Small plastic model kits are used as its miniatures with each taken from the Gundam series. The game uses a d10 dice system for determining initiative, attacks, dodges, maneuvers and other actions taken.

9 plastic models were offered individually for the game as its miniatures.

37784.name: Bords kubb
37784.description:
This is a boardgame version of the outdoors game Kubb.

You play Bords kubb on a board with 9 x 13 squares. Two players against each other start at the edge of the board. Each player has 4 pieces to move, and 5 "kubbs" to "protect" (plus there´s a king in the middle of the board). Movement is dictated by dice rolls. The goal is, first, to place your pieces in the squares occupied by the "kubbs" and, last, the king. The winner is the player that first strikes the king.

37785.name: The Millionaire Maker Game
37785.description:
A roll and move game that is advertised to make one a millionaire in 3-5 years. Retail cost is $149.00.

From the publisher's website:

From three-time, bestselling author and Millionaire Maker, Loral Langemeier, comes The Millionaire Maker Game. This game teaches people real world application wealth building skills as they live the life of an entrepreneur- where big deals are done daily.

If you have ever wanted to help people change their financial destiny – or even your own - here is your chance. Make The Millionaire Maker Game your next Cash Machine by becoming a Millionaire Facilitator. Our Millionaire Facilitator program is an excellent lead generator for any existing business as you host game nights as a front-end marketing tool for your own Cash Machine, and you could even build the Millionaire Facilitator program into a solid business venture of its own.

The Millionaire Maker Game was designed to be a successor to Cashflow 101 by the former master distributor and Kiyosaki (Cashflow 101 designer) trained trainer.


Redevelopment of Cashflow 101

37786.name: See the World

468.name: The United States Playing Card Company

37786.description: This is essentially a memory game and has three different variations. Mystery hand, a variation for two players, and Regular Memory. It varies from memory because the draw card will be the one being matched and players describe what is in their hand at the beginning.

37787.name: Lucky Ladybug
37787.description:
Each player moves their playing piece around the board and the first player to move their playing piece completely around the path of ladybugs and return to the house of their color on the game sheet wins.

After an initial spin on the spinner players move according to the number of spots on the ladybug they are on. If they land on a flower the spinner is used again.

37788.name: Avalanche Mountain
37788.description:
This is an Adventure from The Book of Virtues. From the box:

You can see the snowy summit from a distance. Your goal: reach your friends Plato and Aurora at the top. But this is no simple hike up any old hill. This is a virtue quest to reach the peak of Avalanche Mountain!

Along the way you'll try to acquire virtue chips while avoiding the fault chips. Roll a color and advance, but watch out! At any time someone could roll and AVALANCHE!

In an avalanche, you lift the release gate, sending the cascading marble on its downward journey. It ricochets and rolls down the mountain side, along the vertical playing board.

Avoid being knocked over by an avalanche by having virtue chips. Lose ground if you're knocked over while holding a fault chip.

Will you collect the virtues it takes to make it to the top of Avalanche Mountain?!

37789.name: Samurai Quest
37789.description:
"Board game for 2+ players. Each player controls a Samurai adventuring in the countryside." Set in a fantasy version of old Japan.

"The Board is a circular track divided into 36 spaces. Every sixth space is a Fortress." The game also uses two decks of cards, an Encounter Deck and a Spell Deck.

The players travel around the board, locating companions and items, and encountering foes. Defeating a foe results in an award of Honor Points. The first player to accumulate twenty Honor Points wins.

37790.name: Hercules & Xena
37790.description:
"Card game for 2+ players. Score points for creating adventures featuring your Favorite TV Heroes."

The game uses two custom decks of cards, the Hero Deck and the Foe Deck. Each player keeps two hands of cards, a Hero Hand and a Foe Hand. The players play melds of cards which represents adventures. The score for playing a meld is equal to the sum of the value of the Foe cards played in the meld. The player with the highest score after either deck runs out wins the game.

37791.name: Terrazzo & Terrazzino
37791.description: Players take turns placing tiles (2 at a time) to create closed areas of a single color and/or to create closed corridors which also score.

37792.name: Hogwarts
37792.description:
A card game based on characters and events from the Harry Potter tales.

The game uses two custom decks, the Common Deck and the Challenge Deck. Each player also receives three character cards representing Harry, Hermione, and Ron.

The players use the characters to attempt to overcome challenges from the Harry Potter stories through card play, thus winning Challenge Cards. The winner is the player whose Challenge Cards have the highest total point value.

37793.name: Hastings
37793.description:
"Card game for 2 Players. Simulation of the Battle of Hastings 1066 AD. William, Duke of Normandy has invaded England, defended by The Anglo-Saxon King, Harold Godwin."

Each player uses a unique deck of 63 cards. Each deck is made up of four types of cards (Leader, Unit, Weapons, and Strategy) marked with a force value from 2 to 7. The cards reflect elements of the historical campaign.

The players attempt to play the highest combined force combination on each of three fronts: Left Flank, Center Front, and Right Flank. "Victory: The First player to accumulate 5 Victory markers at any one Front wins."

37794.description:
Magnifico is a "risk like" game of conquest, set in the early 16th century Europe. The players have at their disposal military and financial resources but also the extraordinary inventions of Leonardo da Vinci.

The game comes with a set of plastic figurines: infantry units, castles which towers can be added to and war machines. Following the fertile imagination of Leonard, there are the Aero, the ancestor of aircraft, and Carro prefiguring modern tanks. Other inventions are represented by cards and improve the various elements used in combat. Combat are resolved using special dice. Leonard was also a famous artist and his works of art are related to the victory points.
37794.name: Magnifico

37795.description:
A three-player board wargame of the conflict in China during the Second World War. The players take on the roles of the Japanese invaders, the Nationalist Chinese, and the Communist Chinese. The game uses card play to regulate when pieces may move or attack.

Each turn is one year. The game lasts from 1939 to 1945. The player controlling the most cities at the end of the game wins.

The Game can be found on this website: http://www.angelfire.com/games2/warpspawn/SJW.html
37795.name: Sino-Japanese War

37796.name: Slimed
37796.description:
A Backgammon style game of Ghostbusters versus Ghosts.

The Ghostbuster player only has five pieces representing the team of Ghostbusters. The Ghost player has twenty pieces representing ghosts. The game board is the same as a standard Backgammon board. However, pieces never exit the end of the board, they just keep going around.

The Ghost player wins by capturing (landing and remaining on) all five Ghostbusters, rendering them "slimed." The Ghostbuster player wins by capturing all the Ghosts and placing them in a Containment Field (by landing on them and sending them to the bar.)

37797.name: Space Scouts
37797.description:
"Card and Bookkeeping game. Explore the mysteries of outer space with your trusty ship and intrepid crew."

Each player rolls up a ship with six systems ("skills") and six crew members, each having a random skill or skills.

The game uses a custom deck of cards to create encounters and missions. There are four types of cards in the deck: Mission, Threat, Mishap, and Aid.

"Object: Have the most mission and threat cards in your Completion Pile by the end of the game."

Rules variants allow for solo play, replacing the card deck die roll tables, and for playing with the cards divided into three separate decks.

37798.name: Speed Racer
37798.description:
“Go Speed Racer! Go! Pick your Driver, Car, Modifications, and go!”

The game is played with five custom decks: Driver, Car, Equipment, Action, and Episode. Each player begins with one driver and car and three pieces of equipment. The players try to acquire Speed Points as quickly as possible by overcoming Villain, Foe, and Obstacle Cards.

“Victory: It takes 50 Speed Points to cross the Finish line. Determine 1st, 2nd, and 3rd place.”


Microbadges:

37799.name: Star Fleets
37799.description:
"Card game for two players. Battle between opposing fleets in the Star Trek Universe."

"The Decks: Each player gets one unique deck."

The game includes decks for the United Federation of Planets, the Klingon Empire, the Romulan Star Empire, the Kzinti Hegemony, the Gorn Confederation, the Tholian Holdfast, the Hydran Kingdom, and the Lyran Star Empire.

"Cards: Types of cards include: Ships, Personnel, Control, and Combat cards."

"Each player starts with a Fleet Total of 100 points. You win if you reduce your opponents Fleet Total to zero points."

37800.name: Stormbringer
37800.description:
"Two player card game depicting the struggle between Law & Chaos in Moorcock’s Elric Fantasies."

The game uses two decks of cards, the Law Deck and the Chaos Deck. The players control their respective decks. Each player also starts with four Balance Tokens.

"Victory: The first player to control all 8 Balance Tokens wins the game."

37801.name: Tavern Brawl
37801.description:
"Card Game for 2 (or more) players. Common Deck CCG Format. Fantasy Theme. A Fight breaks out at Ye Olde Dragon Tavern (& Inn). Recruit Characters to 'your side' to knock out your opponent’s Characters and drink all his beer."

"Characters have 2 Stats: Hits & Strength. Each Character has one or more traits, such as Mage or Fighter."

"Each player starts with 10 Bottles of Beer on the Wall."

"Victory: Reduce your opponent to zero Beers."

37802.name: The Last Starfighter Skirmish
37802.description:
"Board & card game for 2 players. Battle between ships of the Star League & the Kodan Armada takes place in the Last Starfighter Universe. Each figure represents a single Station, Gunship or Squad of Fighters."

The game is played on a chessboard or any other 8x8 grid. Miniatures or counters are used to represent the ships. The Star League player has eight ships and the Kodan Armada player has fourteen ships. Card play determines when units may move, attack, and defend.

The object of the game is to destroy all enemy ships.

37803.name: WWI Combined Arms
37803.description:
"Board game for 2 players. World War I theme. No dice or cards. Each unit represents a squad, gun, or vehicle."

The game is played on a chessboard or any other 8x8 grid. There are three types of terrain: Bunkers, Trenches, and No-Mans-Land.

Miniatures or counters are used to represent the units. There are eight different types of units: Infantry, Sniper, Machine Gun, Tank, Artillery, Headquarters, Flame Thrower, and Trench Raiders. Each player designs an army of sixteen units.

The object of the game is to destroy the enemy headquarters.

37804.name: WWII Combined Arms
37804.description:
"Board game for 2 players. World War II theme. No dice or cards. Each unit represents a brigade or battalion."

The game is played on a chessboard or any other 8x8 grid. Miniatures or counters are used to represent the units.

There are thirteen types of units: General Infantry, Paratroopers, Engineers, Mechanized Infantry, Light Tanks, Medium Tanks, Heavy Tanks, Howitzers, Anti-Tank Guns, Anti-Aircraft Guns, Airfield, Fortifications, and Headquarters. Each player designs an army of sixteen units.

The object of the game is to destroy the enemy headquarters.

37805.name: Xanth Quest
37805.description:
"Board and Card game for 2+ players. Based on the Xanth series by Piers Anthony." Particularly inspired by the first Xanth novel, A Spell for Chameleon.

The game is played on a track 63 spaces long, with each space being large enough to hold a card. The middle space is the Gap Chasm. Each time a player lands on an empty space, a card is drawn. A Challenge Card represents an encounter or event that must be resolved. A Location Card is left on the space occupied by the player who drew the card.

"Victory: Be the first player to get your pawn to the end space and then back to the Starting space. (It’s a race game.) This represents a quest involving a trek across the dangerous wilderness of Xanth."

37806.name: Yellow Submarine
37806.description:
"Board & Dice game for 2-4+ players. Based on the Song/Movie by the Beatles."

"The Board is a psychedelic winding track of 39 spaces." Ten spaces are marked as Song Spaces. A player landing on a Song Space must draw a Song Card and sing the song. Nine other spaces are Adventure Spaces named after items in the movie. A player landing on one of these spaces must roll the die and move backwards that many spaces.

"Winning: Make it to the End Space & sing (Everybody now…) All You Need is Love."

37807.name: Napoleonic Empire
37807.description:
"Two player strategic war game set in the Napoleonic era. One player controls France & Napoleon. The other player controls the Allies. The allies include England, Russia, Prussia, and Austria."

This area movement game uses generic units. Cards provide for combat bonuses and other effects, such as additional reinforcements.
"Victory: The Allies win if they control France at the end of their turn. The French win if they control all continental countries at the end of their turn."

37808.name: Qadesh
37808.description:
"Wargame for two players. Simulation of the Battle of Qadesh in 1300 BC. Clash of the Warrior Kings."

The game is played on a chess board or other 8x8 grid. The board includes several terrain features, such as the River Orontes, Lake of Homs, settlements, mud flats, hills, and encampments.

There are rules included to represent fatigue, morale, shock battle, and missile combat.

"Victory: Destroy the enemy unit containing the opposing Leader, or occupy his camp and remove any 2 of his armies from play."

37809.description:
Rally Racer Dice is a lite dice and statistics game. In the game players generate a random course and then purchase bonus's which help them on specific sections of said course.

Part of the One Page War series
37809.name: Rally Racer Dice

37810.name: Swarm
37810.description:
"2-4+ player board & card wargame. Each player controls an insect swarm."

The game is played on a hex grid. Each hex is filled with a randomly determined terrain: Dirt, Grass, Mound, Rocks, Water, Den, Mud, Slope, Roots, or Sand.

Each player begins with three Insect counters. Each Insect is rated for attack, defense, movement, and reproductive capacity. In addition, each player's Swarm is rated for Intelligence and Initiative.

There are two ways to win the game. You must either control all of the Den spaces on the map or occupy the most spaces when the card deck runs out.

37811.name: Magus
37811.description:
A game of conflict between fantasy armies.

The game is played on a 13x13 grid. The square at each corner of the board holds a tower. To win the game you must have an army on all four tower spaces.

The players travel around the board recruiting fighting units. Units are recruited by landing on an empty space and drawing a card from the colored card deck (of the five) which correlates to the color of the space. Each card describes a unit by name, Force value, and number of spells. Separate card decks describe for magic spells and artifacts.

37812.name: Magic Encounters
37812.description:
"Fantasy Strategy Wargame for 2 or more players. Lead your
race and their allies to ultimate victory."

The game is played on a 5x5 grid. Each space is marked with one of five territory types: Plains, Mountains, Swamps, Water, or Forest.

Each player has an army of 40 tokens in a unique color. The players start with one stack of 10 tokens, placed in opposite corners.

"Victory: Eliminate all enemy Tokens from Play."

37813.name: Swords & Such
37813.description:
An abstract wargame for two or more players. The object of the game is to capture your opponent's King.

The game is played on a 12x12 grid with two types of terrain - clear spaces and mountain spaces. Pieces cannot move through mountain spaces.

Each player has a set of fifteen units: a King, four Knights, four Archers, and six Foot soldiers. The pieces are set up as desired in the player's back two rows.

Dice are used to determine movement and the range of archery attacks.

Optional rules provide for catapults and horse archers.

37814.name: Thirty Years Warfare
37814.description:
"Card Game for 2-4+ players. The Thirty Years War took place in Germany from 1618-1648. The main adversaries were the Catholics and the Protestants. Each player takes the role of a Military Contractor of the age. The goal is to use your skill as a general and an entrepreneur to amass wealth and fame."

Each player creates a Leader character with three random traits (skills). Each Leader has a Reputation score, which starts at 0 and is increased or decreased based on the Leader's performance in campaigns.

A Leader gains gold each turn based on the value of his employment contract. An additional random amount of gold is gained each turn for "savings, investments, contributions, estate incomes, financial backers, looting, etc."

"Victory: When the deck runs out, the player with the most Gold wins. If two players are tied, the player with the highest Reputation score wins."

37815.description:
"Wargame. Set piece battles. Simulates battles between the six main warrior races of Mars during the Era of Discontent. During this turbulent period, factions of all races fought with and against each other. Welcome to Mars."

The game is played on a hex map and uses up to twenty types of terrain/settlements: Barren, Impassable, Flats, Forest, Swamp, Hills, Caves, Mountains, Jungles, Psiwell, Desert, Fortifications, Dojo, Vehicle Factory, Weapons Factory, Training Grounds, Farms, Temple, City, and Ruins.

There are six races in the game: Green, Red, White, Blue, Yellow, and Black Martians. Each Martian race has warbands and leaders. The warbands of each race are rated from 0 to 6 in the following attributes: Speed, Small Arms, Surprise, Hand to Hand, Armor, Artillery, Numbers, Psionics, and Morale.

Variant Warband ratings are included for special units such as Red Commandos, Yellow Wasp Riders, Blue Mob, Black Warlocks, and Green Beetle Tanks.
37815.name: Warrior Races of Mars

37816.name: The First Balkan War
37816.description:
"Wargame for 4 players. Simulates the First Balkan War in 1912. One player is the Ottoman Turks. The other 3 players are the members of the Balkan League: Serbia, Bulgaria, and Greece."

The counters represent divisions of 10,000 men. The Ottomans have twenty-four divisions, Bulgaria has eleven, Greece has ten, and Serbia has eleven. In addition, the Serbian Army includes one division of Montenegro Guerrillas.

The game ends after twenty-four turns. The player with the most Victory Points wins. Victory points are awarded for spaces controlled at the end of the game, with more points being awarded for controlling cities and fortifications.

37817.name: Japanese Swords
37817.description:
A board game of warfare in Feudal Japan. The components include a map, a set of counters for each player, and a card deck of approximately 100 cards.

The game is played on a 10x10 grid marked with seven terrain types (Clear, Fortress, Keep, Difficult, Covered, Treacherous, and Impassable). Each set of counters includes four different types: Armies, Gold, Honor, and Control Markers. Each player starts with one Fortress and two Armies.

The object of the game is to capture the fortresses of your opponents.

37818.name: Mass Warfare
37818.description:
"WWII Technology. Generic countries. Production and strategic combat."

"Each player should begin by controlling a corner of the map that contains several cities (Population of around 15) and enough agricultural land to feed them. They should also have access to nearby mines & oil fields. Each player starts with reserves of 30 oil and 30 metal. Each side starts with 1 Factory and 5 Infantry units positioned adjacent to the city hexes."

The object of the game is to control all of the cities on the map.

37819.name: Jugger
37819.description:
"Fantasy tactical rule system. Juggers or Jugs are giant war machines constructed with medieval technology." Juggers are not only used in warfare, but also for a sport called Juggerball which is played with a very large ball.

Jugger is played on a hex map. That map can represent playing fields, racing traps, mazes, or battlefields depending on the scenario." Statistics are given for over thirty Juggers used by various armies.

Each Jugger is rated for four traits: Size class, acceleration rate, deceleration rate, and turn rate.

37820.name: Solar Invasion 2100
37820.description:
"The year is 2100. Human beings have been intensively colonizing the solar system for the last 70 years in relative peace."

"The Kathar are still a young race: aggressive, and impetuous. They have conquered numerous other less militant races. They are currently fighting wars on several fronts. Initial reconnaissance of Earth mistook us for a peaceful race. There was no reports of Nuclear Weapon stockpiles. A small task force was sent to enslave us. The Kathar ships use antimatter energy weapons."

"The Earth wins if all of the Mother Ships are destroyed. The [Alien] fighters are not jump capable, and will self destruct. The Aliens win if Earth is destroyed."

The game is played using two identical hex maps. Each turn the players first move their units and place attack markers on their own maps. Then the players look at each others' maps and attacks are resolved. Variant rules are provided for using a single hex map.

37821.name: Warbah
37821.description:
"Fantasy conquest. Characterized by Gold and bookkeeping. Explore, expand your territory, collect gold, find artifacts, cast spells, raise armies, gain experience, send out spies, crush your enemies."

Each player starts with a capitol city, a hero, a wandering wizard, one to ten gold, and one to ten of the four basic troop units: Warriors, Archers, Cavalry, and Catapults.

The game includes rules permitting espionage and alliances.

37822.name: Space Cruisers
37822.description:
"Very simple space ship combat."

"Every military ship has the following basic features: 10 Hull points, 1 Phaser, 3 Drives, 1 Shield. In the Basic rules every ship has 5 additional systems. Roll 5 times on the System table to see which systems a ship has." Advanced rules allow for custom ship construction, using a point system.

"Each side should have an equal number of figures. Or each side should have an equal number of construction points if using the advanced rules."

37823.name: Superhero Slugfest
37823.description:
"Smash! Blam! Pow! Quick & dirty tactical rules for Superhero combat."

The game is played on a hex map with spaces large enough to accommodate miniature figures.

Superheroes are rated for Attack, Damage, Defend, Hits, Speed, and Range (hand to hand). Numerous powers and special abilities are also defined in the rules.

Stats for eleven superhero teams are given. "A typical team will have four members and a theme."

"The basic scenario: Each side picks or creates a team and they proceed to beat each other to a pulp."

37824.name: Superhero Slugfest Card Combat
37824.description:
A card game of superhero combat. Each player uses a custom deck of cards which represents all of the members and powers of one Superhero Team.

Each deck has forty cards to represent the four team members. There are ten cards for each Superhero, five Character Cards and five Ability Cards. Each card has a force value of 1 to 5. A player tries to knock out opposing Superheroes by playing cards with a higher total force value than those played by the opposing player.

"You win if you KO all of your opponents Superheroes."

37825.name: Sword & Sorcery Slugfest
37825.description:
A simple tactical game of fantasy combat between individual wizards and warriors.

The game is played on a hex map with spaces large enough to accommodate miniature figures.

Characters are rated for Attack, Damage, Defend, Hits, Speed, and Range (hand to hand). Warriors carry a magical melee weapon with a randomly determined special ability. Wizards have a randomly determined assortment of spells.

Characters earn experience by defeating opponents. Experience can be used to enhance traits or to acquire additional spells.

37826.name: Supercritter Slugfest
37826.description:
"Combat rules for cute animae mini monsters." An expansion for Superhero Slugfest, the quick and dirty tactical rules for superhero combat.

The game is played on a hex map with spaces large enough to accommodate miniature figures.

Supercritters are rated for Attack, Damage, Defend, Hits, Speed, and Range (hand to hand). Each Supercritter also has ten super powers. Stats are included for three Supercritter teams. Evolution rules provide for Supercritter experience and advancement.

"Basic scenario objectives: Each side picks or creates a team. Combat may be one on one or a free for all. Match Locations: Critter Combat Arena, The Mall, School yard, etc."

37827.name: Space Fury
37827.description:
"Quick & Dirty Tactical Space Fighter Combat Rules. Special rules for pilots: 10 Skills, Panic, Quirks, Special maneuvers. Very easy ship construction system."

"A space hex map is required. Use painted miniatures or chits to represent ships. 10 and 6 sided dice are used."

The rules cover concepts such as stealth, detection, missiles, guns, morale, factions, and formations. There is also a random skirmish scenario generator.

37828.name: Mutog
37828.description:
"Wargame for 2+ players. Players control bands of warriors in a post-apocalyptic wasteland. Eclectic unit types with a wide range of technologies."

"Victory: Wipe your enemies off the face of whats left of the earth. Or capture all the Towns or kill all enemy Heroes."

37829.name: Men of Sumer
37829.description:
"Players a rival kings in the land of Sumeria."

The game is played on a hex map depicting the Fertile Crescent between the Tigris and Euphrates rivers. There are ten City States on the map: Kish, Larak, Nippur, Umma, Lagash, Uruk, Ur, Eshnunna, Khafaje, and Eridu.

"Victory: The first player to control six of the ten city-states is the winner."

37830.name: Planet Busters
37830.description:
A game of interplanetary warfare where the goal is to destroy all of your opponent's planets. This is done with Planet Busters, a powerful weapon carried by certain types of spaceships.

Components include a hex mapsheet, ten and six sided dice, and an assortment of counters. Common counters include Resource counters, Planet Buster counters, and the 84 Ship counters. In addition, each player has Fleet counters and Planet counters in a unique color.

There are twenty-one ship types in the game. Players build new spaceships by expending Resource counters. Resource counters are earned by controlling planets.

37831.name: Sea Battles
37831.description:
"Abstract WWII Naval Strategy Game."

The pieces represent seven types of ships: PT Boat, Submarine, Destroyer, Frigate, Cruiser, Battleship, and Carrier. Each unit is individually rated for hits, movement, range, damage, and number of attacks.

"Use an 8 x 8 or larger square or hex map. All ships can move and shoot vertical and horizontal but not diagonal. Each side starts with 1 of each ship and 2 destroyers for a total of 8 ships."

"On the Sea map mark several spaces as land obstacles. Ships cannot move over land but they can shoot over it. Torpedo attacks cannot be made over land."

"Objective: Completely destroy all enemy ships."

37832.name: Traveler 1800
37832.description:
A semi-historical game/simulation, in the style of En Garde!, representing the experiences a British Naval Officer might have faced in the Napoleonic era as popularly depicted in the Horatio Hornblower novels and other media.

By rolling on a series of tables, the player generates advancements, events, and achievements for his character. "Keep track of Prizes, Engagements fought, and Total Merits received as well as Rank. Be sure to name the Ships you are posted to."

37833.description:
"Players control Viking clans that raid settlements on the Mainland. The player with the most loot at the end of 20 turns is the winner."

In this simple game of exploration and conquest, the players may build, recruit or buy six types of units: Long Ship, Dragon Ship, Chieftain, Vikings, Berserkers, and Scout. The mainland forces consist of three types of units: Peasant Militia, Men at Arms, and Knights. The number of mainland units encountered depends on the type of settlement discovered. Settlement types include Farm, Village, Church, Town, City, and Castle.

At the start of the game, the land masses on the mapsheet are blank. The terrain and settlements are filled in as the players explore the map.
37833.name: Viking Loot

37834.name: Whale Hunters
37834.description:
"Card game for 2-4 players. Early 19th Century Whale Hunting Theme."

"Scale: Each Player represents one Whaling Ship of European/American Identity. One Game represents one Whaling Season."

"Game End: The Game ends when players have gone through the deck twice."

"Victory: At the end of the game the player with the most Blubber Tokens wins."

An optional rule allows they players to represent particular Whaling Nations. There is also a solitaire dice based variant which replaces the cards with tables.

37835.name: WWI Many Fronts
37835.description:
"Two Player Card & Bidding game. Simulation of World War I (The Great War)"

The game last 18 turns, spanning the time period of 1914-1918.

"One Player is the Entente Powers (EP): Britain, France, Russia, Serbia, Italy, Romania, Greece, USA. The other Player is the Central Powers (CP): Austria-Hungary, Germany, Bulgaria, Turkey."

The game is played across six fronts: Western, Eastern, Balkan, Italian, Turkish, and the "War at Sea." There are three Territory Markers at each Front. A Front is captured by winning all three Territory Markers at the Front.

"Victory: The first player to capture the Western Front wins the War. If the EP captures the Eastern Front he wins the War. After 18 turns the player who has captured the most Fronts wins, otherwise it is a Stalemate."

boardgamehonor.21158: 2010 Charles S. Roberts Best Ancient to Napoleonic Era Board Wargame Nominee

37836.description:
Julius Caesar is a two-player game, depicting the later Roman civil wars (49-45 BC). The forces of Caesar are pitted against those of Pompey.

From the publisher:
Julius Caesar brings the drama of the Roman Civil War to life. Players take control of the legions of Caesar or Pompey and fight to rule Rome as Emperor.

From the Designer:

Julius Caesar is a card driven block game. You use cards to Move, levy or play an Event. 13 victory point Towns or Cities are depicted on the 17"x 33" (43 x 84 cm) game board of the Mediterranean. Take command of Caesar's Veteran Legions or Pompey sprouting Young Legions around the Mediterranean. You decide how best to defend or conquer the Republic. With endless possibilities at your disposal this game will keep your adrenaline pumping. The only question I have for you, the game player, is, are you ready to prove that you deserve to be Emperor of the Rome? Come prove it on the game board!
37836.name: Julius Caesar

37837.name: Tlachtli
37837.description:
"Board & Card game for two players. Based on the Aztec sport of the same name."

The game is played on a 13x7 grid. There are three pawns, one representing the ball and two representing blockers. The movement of the pieces is controlled by card play. All of the pieces may be moved by either player.

"Victory: The first player to score 4 points is the winner. The other player’s team is sacrificed to the gods."

37838.name: Tlatelolco
37838.description:
"Tlatelolco was the great market for the Aztec Empire. The Aztecs had no coins; so all trade was by barter. Players are pochteca (merchants) trying to acquire certain goods."

Players move their pochteca around the 8×8 board to visit merchant stands in the market. Each player is attempt to collect six target goods randomly determined for each player. In addition, the players need to avoid the thief who prowls around the marketplace.

37839.name: Troy
37839.description:
"Card game for 2 players. One player is the Achaeans (Greeks). The other player is the Trojans."

Each player uses a unique deck of cards. There are ten types of cards: Hero, Companion, God, Warrior, Strategy, Arms, Event, Trait, Honor and Defenses. Each card is marked with a Force value from 1 to 15. The cards represent specific elements of the Trojan War.

The players attempt to play the highest ranking card combination each hand. The first player to win seven hands wins the game.

37840.name: Truckin
37840.description:
"Card game for 2-4+ players. Players are Truck Drivers. Set in the USA in the 1970’s. Heavy on CB Lingo. Players try to complete routes."

The game uses a custom deck of cards with four suits: Rig, City, Haulin, and Smokey. Each card is marked with a number from 1 to 6, which affect how cards can be combined into melds.

When a meld is played, another player may disrupt it with a Smokey card. If the meld is not disrupted, the player who played it marks off one route as completed.

"Winning: The first player to complete 5 Routes is the winner."

37841.name: The Mystic Warriors of the Plains
37841.description:
"Each player takes the role of an (American) Indian Brave (Young Warrior). Players compete to accumulate prestige by their deeds."

The game uses a custom deck of cards. There are nine types of cards in the deck: Tribe, Weapon, Dress, Approach, Coup, Hunt/Trade, Luck, Spirit, and Trade. The cards are used to engage in various activities.

Players collect Eagle Feathers by participating in raids, which come in four different types: Horse Raids, War Parties, Revenge Raids, and Pipeholder Raids. Players may also hunt, hold tribal gatherings, and trade.

"Victory: The first player to accumulate 28 Eagle Feathers has enough to make his Warbonnet and wins the game."

37842.name: Three Kingdoms Combined Arms
37842.description:
"Board game for 2+ players. Chinese Three Kingdoms theme. No dice or cards. The Three Empires were the Wei, Shu, & Wu. Each unit represents several hundred soldiers."

The game is played on a 12x12 square grid with ten cities marked on it. There are also ten squares marked as forest and ten marked as mountains. Each player starts in control of a 5x5 corner of the grid.

There are seven types of fighting units in the game: General, Armored Cavalry, Infantry, Archers, Rockets, Shock Troops, and Horse Archers. Each unit is rated for movement, attack range, and defense.

"Victory: Destroy all enemy Generals or occupy all cities."

37843.name: Kingdoms and Crowns
37843.description: Kingdoms and Crowns is a board game in the tradition of games such as Talisman. The game is set in a fantasy world of elves and dragons. The premise of the game is that the rule of the realm has died and many parties are now maneuvering their candidates to take the throne. However, absolute power will be difficult to achieve. To become rule of the realm you must have the backing of the most influential powers in the land, but you should also have support form the Otherworld. There is one way to become the undisputed ruler of the realm, and that is to recover a legendary crown that once belonged to the most powerful rule to have ever ruled the land. Legend has it that the crown was stolen and is now somewhere on the Planes of Damnation. Only a hero of great power and skill could ever hope to enter those lands and return. Alternatively it be just simpler to remove the competition.

37844.name: Tunnel Rat
37844.description:
"Vietnam War tunnel combat. Bluffing game for 2 players. One Player is the US Tunnel Rat. The other player is the VC."

By asking questions, the US player must determine if the VC's current card is a tunnel, Viet Cong unit, or trap. The US player must acquire five tunnel cards before the VC player can inflict five casualties.

37845.name: Vampire Prince
37845.description:
"2+ Player card game. Players are Elder Vampires vying to be the uncontested Prince of a city. Based on the White Wolf RPG Vampire the Masquerade and the associated Deckmaster card game Jyhad."

The game uses a custom card deck. There are seven different types of cards: Vampire, Event, Location, Political Organization, Combat Event, Modifier, and Damage.

"Victory: Be the first to control cards with a combined political value of 20+ or kill all the opposing Elder Vampires."

37846.name: Viborg Spillet
37846.description:
The game of buying and selling industries in the danish town Viborg. Each player controls a car, and opts to buy the best businesses in Viborg to charge fees from the other players. The last player with all the money is the winner.

The game plays very similar to Monopoly.

37847.name: The Dangerous Book for Boys Game
37847.description:
From the box:

The adventure game based on the best-selling book!

You've been shipwrecked on a deserted island on a deserted island with nothing but your wits and some string to save you. Thank goodness you've been reading your Dangerous Book for Boys!
